intro: Perihemia coarctata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, storing water in its thick leaves and stems. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open, sun-exposed areas. Perihemia coarctata is a low-growing shrub that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
